summary: This bill, the SNAP E&T Data And Technical Assistance (DATA) Act of 2025, amends the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 to provide grants to state agencies. These grants aim to create and strengthen administrative databases and resources focused on employment and training programs related to the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP). The bill outlines the criteria for awarding grants, including priorities like data infrastructure improvement, program effectiveness, data sharing, and privacy protections. It also mandates a Government Accountability Office (GAO) report to assess the implementation and offer recommendations.
